alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Eastland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 7:55PM CDT until May 07 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Texas and north central Texas, including the following counties, in central Texas, Comanche. In north central Texas, Eastland. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Comanche, De Leon, Gorman, Rising Star, Proctor Lake, Lake Leon, Lake Olden, Pleasant Hill, Carbon, Staff, Comyn, Kokomo, Sabanno, Duster, Beattie, Sipe Springs, Rucker, Sidney, Okra and Downing.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
